item.name: Post

request.description:
Return all the posts in the database.

All the fields except `comments` of each post would be returned.

Results are sorted by the `creationDate` in descending order. > On success, a HTTP `200` status code would be returned.

response.name: Get All Posts Example

request.description:
Return the post with the given `post_id`.
> On success, a HTTP `200` status code would be returned, along with the specified post.
>
> If the post with the given ID was not found, a `404` status code would be returned.

request.description:
Return all the posts posted by the user with the given `user_id`.

All the fields except `comments` of each post would be returned.

Results are sorted by the `creationDate` in descending order. > On success, a HTTP `200` status code would be returned.

request.description:
Add a new post to the database.
> On success, a HTTP `200` status code would be returned, along with the newly added post.
>
> If the format of the request body is illegal, a `400` status code would be returned.

response.name: Add A Post Example
response.body:
{
    "numLikes": 0,
    "numViews": 0,
    "solved": false,
    "_id": "6120adbd897bd96b34ce3ac1",
    "uid": "auth0|1110b5c4c61fd70077d2819d",
    "title": "Test Post 3",
    "content": "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet consectetur adipisicing elit. Harum nemo a temporibus nobis animi ipsam sint impedit, nostrum soluta adipisci.",
    "creationDate": "2021-08-21T07:39:41.873Z",
    "comments": [],
    "__v": 0
}

request.description:
Update fields of the post specified by the `post_id` parameter and the request body.

**Note:** If you want to update the `comments` section, you need to provide a full array of objects.

> On success, a HTTP `200` status code would be returned, along with the updated post. > > If the format of the request body is illegal, a `400` status code would be returned. > > If the post with the given `post_id` was not found, a `404` status code would be returned.

response.name: Update A Post Example
response.body:
{
    "numLikes": 0,
    "numViews": 0,
    "solved": false,

    "title": "Test Post",
    "content": "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet consectetur adipisicing elit. Harum nemo a temporibus nobis animi ipsam sint impedit, nostrum soluta adipisci.",
    "creationDate": "2021-08-20T12:16:33.072Z",
    "comments": [
        {
            "numLikes": 2,
            "_id": "6120cba837e37fbd4048e983",
            "uid": "auth0|6110b5c4c61fd70077d2819d",
            "content": "sdfsdfkjslkfjsldkfj",
            "creationDate": "2021-08-21T09:47:20.844Z"
        }
    ],
    "__v": 0
}

request.description:
Delete the post with the given `post_id`.
> On success, a HTTP `200` status code would be returned, along with the deleted post.
>
> If the post with the given `post_id` was not found, a `404` status code would be returned.

item.description:
API calls related to post section.

A `post` has the following schema:
> - `uid` : user id of the user who creates the post > > string, generated by Auth0 > - `title` : title of this post > > string, 5 - 100 characters > - `content` : main body of this post > > string, 5 - 1000 characters > - `creationDate` : date when the user creates this post > > date, auto generated by MongoDB when creating the post > - `numLikes` : number of likes of this post > > int, default: 0 > - `numViews` : number of views of this post > > int, default: 0 > - `solved` : if this post has been solved > > bool, default: false > - `comments` : comments of this post > > [`comment`], array of `comment` objects which is defined below
A `comment` has the following schema:
> - `uid` : user id of the user who writes this comment > > string, generated by Auth0 > - `content` : content of this comment > > string, 5 - 1000 characters > - `creationDate` : date when the user writes this comment > > date, auto generated by MongoDB when create this comment > - `numLikes` : number of likes of this comment > > int, default: 0

item.name: Submission

request.description:
Return all the submissions in the database.

> On success, a HTTP `200` status code would be returned.

Return the submission with the given `submission_id`.
> On success, a HTTP `200` status code would be returned, along with the specified submission.
>
> If the submission with the given ID was not found, a `404` status code would be returned.

response.name: Get Submission By Submission ID Example

item.name: Get All Submissions By Survey ID

request.description:
Return all the submissions associated with the survey with the given `survey_id`.

> On success, a HTTP `200` status code would be returned. > > If the survey with the given `survey_id` was not found, a `404` status code would be returned

response.name: Get All Submissions By Survey ID Example

request.description:
Add a new submission to the database.
> On success, a HTTP `200` status code would be returned, along with the newly added submission.
>
> If the format of the request body is illegal, a `400` status code would be returned.

item.description:
API calls related to submission section.

A `submission` has the following schema:
> - `survey` : survey id of the survey associated with this submission > > object id, generated by MongoDB > - `responses` : responses to the survey > > [`response`], array of `response` objects which is defined below
A `response` has the following schema:
> - `index` : index of the question > > int > - `response` : response to the question > > string, 0 - 200 characters

item.name: Survey

request.description:
Return all the surveys in the database.

Onle `title` and `creationDate` of each post would be returned.

Results are sorted by the `creationDate` in descending order. > On success, a HTTP `200` status code would be returned.

Return the survey with the given `survey_id`.
> On success, a HTTP `200` status code would be returned, along with the specified survey.
>
> If the survey with the given ID was not found, a `404` status code would be returned.

response.name: Get Survey By Survey ID Example
response.body:
{
    "visible": true,
    "_id": "6120b0aaf77cdbe38c83c9ab",
    "creator": "auth0|6110b5c4c61fd70077d2819d",
    "title": "Hidden Survey",
    "questions": [
        {
            "questionType": "multiple choice",
            "choices": [],
            "_id": "6120b0aaf77cdbe38c83c9ac",
            "index": 0,
            "question": "This is a test question"
        },
        {
            "questionType": "short answer",
            "choices": [],
            "_id": "6120b0aaf77cdbe38c83c9ad",
            "index": 1,
            "question": "This is a test question"
        }
    ],
    "creationDate": "2021-08-21T07:52:10.296Z",
    "__v": 0
}

request.description:
Add a new survey to the database.
> On success, a HTTP `200` status code would be returned, along with the newly added survey.
>
> If the format of the request body is illegal, a `400` status code would be returned.

response.body:
{
    "visible": true,
    "_id": "6120b01f2e97589ad00e31f1",

            "index": 1,
            "question": "This is a test question"
        }
    ],
    "creationDate": "2021-08-21T07:49:51.314Z",
    "__v": 0
}

request.description:
Update fields of the survey specified by the `survey_id` parameter and the request body.

**Note:** If you want to update the `questions` section, you need to provide a full array of objects.

> On success, a HTTP `200` status code would be returned, along with the updated survey. > > If the format of the request body is illegal, a `400` status code would be returned. > > If the survey with the given `survey_id` was not found, a `404` status code would be returned.

response.name: Update A Survey Example
response.body:
{
    "visible": false,
    "_id": "6120b0aaf77cdbe38c83c9ab",
    "creator": "auth0|6110b5c4c61fd70077d2819d",
    "title": "Hidden Survey",
    "questions": [
        {
            "questionType": "multiple choice",
            "choices": [],
            "_id": "6120b0aaf77cdbe38c83c9ac",
            "index": 0,
            "question": "This is a test question"
        },
        {
            "questionType": "short answer",
            "choices": [],
            "_id": "6120b0aaf77cdbe38c83c9ad",
            "index": 1,
            "question": "This is a test question"
        }
    ],
    "creationDate": "2021-08-21T07:52:10.296Z",
    "__v": 0
}

item.description:
API calls related to survey section.

A `survey` has the following schema:
> - `creator` : user id of the user who creates the survey > > string, generated by Auth0 > - `title` : title of this survey > > string, 5 - 100 characters > - `questions` : questions of this survey > > [`question`], array of `question` objects which is defined below > - `creationDate` : date when the user creates this survey > > date, auto generated by MongoDB when create this curvey > - `visible` : if this survey is currently visible to other users > > bool, default: true
A `question` has the following schema:
> - `index` : index of the question > > int > - `questionType` : type of this question > > enum, ["short answer", "multiple choice", "multiple answer"] > - `question` : the actual question asked > > string, 5 - 100 characters > - `choices` : choices for the user when answering "multiple choice/answer" type of questions > > int or string, required for multiple choice/answer type of questions, forbidden for "short answer" type of questions
